text.__SUMMARY__: The Mona Island boa (Chilabothrus monensis) is a species of snake in the family Boidae. It is endemic to the West Indies.
text.Distribution and habitat: Chilabothrus monensis is found in the West Indies, around Mona Island and Cayo Diablo near Puerto Rico, in the U.S. Virgin Islands, and in the British Virgin Islands: Tortola, Great Camanoe, Necker, and Virgin Gorda.
text.Subspecies:
Two subspecies are recognized, including the nominotypical subspecies.

Chilabothrus monensis granti Stull, 1933
Chilabothrus monensis monensis Zenneck, 1898
text.Further reading: Zenneck J (1898). "Die Zeichnung der Boiden ". Zeitschrift für Wissenschaftliche Zoologie 64: 1-384. (Epicrates monensis, new species, pp. 64–66). (in German).
